DataElement.preferredName: Patient Cancer and Leukemia Group B Clinical Study Associated Enrollment Number
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the Cooperative Group-specific alphanumeric identifier assigned to an NCI-sponsored companion protocol by the Cancer and Leukemia Group B (CALGB).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Cancer and Leukemia Group B Clinical Study Associated Enrollment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the patient enrollment in an associated (joined in some kind of relationship) or companion CALGB study.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Cancer and Leukemia Group B Clinical Study Associated Enrollment
Property.preferredDefinition: The Cancer and Leukemia Group B (CALGB) is a national clinical research group - network of 29 university medical centers, over 185 community hospitals and more than almost 3000 physicians - sponsored by the NCI, with its Central Office headquartered at the University of Chicago, and its Statistical Center located at Duke University, founded in 1955 with a goal of bringing together clinical and laboratory research.:Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, mechanism of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiology, behavior and health services research. :Joined in some kind of relationship.:Enrollment; to insert, register, or enter in a list, catalog, or roll. (Merriam-Webster Online)

Concepts.definition: A national clinical research group - network of 29 university medical centers, over 185 community hospitals and more than almost 3000 physicians - sponsored by the NCI, with its Central Office headquartered at the University of Chicago, and its Statistical Center located at Duke University, founded in 1955 with a goal of bringing together clinical and laboratory research.

Research conducted with human subjects or on material of human origin in which an investigator directly interacts with human subjects; includes development of new technologies, study of mechanisms of human diseases, therapy, clinical trials, epidemiologic, behavior, and health services research.
Joined in some kind of relationship.
The act of registration, entering in a list, catalog, group, study; also, the number of subjects enrolled.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the numeric or alphanumeric identification assigned to the study by the National Cancer Institute.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the identification of cancer research protocols.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Number; a concept of quantity derived from zero and units; a numeral or string of numerals that is used for identification.

Concepts.definition: A numeral or string of numerals expressing value, quantity, or identification.

DataElement.origin: CALGB CRF:Cancer and Leukemia Group B Case Report Form
